job description:
Joule, a System One division is seeking a Scientist III for a contract position. With more than 6,000 employees and roughly 40 offices throughout the , clinical, engineering, energy, IT, legal and administrative staffing services. For more than 40 years, we have delivered workforce solutions and integrated services to clients nationally.

The Scientist III will:

Responsibilities:
  • Develop, validate and run clinical biomarker assays using Quantitative QQQ Mass Spectrometry. Provide support for all therapeutic areas and all phases of clinical development at the company.
  • Assist in the transition of biomarker assays from Basic Research to Clinical by providing technical guidance on fit-for-purpose assay validation.
  • Interface with scientists and physicians in early and late stage clinical development to execute on biomarker strategies in clinical trials.
  • Writing memos, final reports and publications summarizing data, and writing/updating lab SOPs.
  • Serve as a subject matter expert in tissue-based assay development and validation, collaborating with project teams, biomarker leaders, clinical operations and regulatory affairs on the implementation of these assays in clinical trials
    • Requirements:
  • BS, BA, MS or PhD in a life sciences discipline (Biochemistry, Immunology, Molecular Pathology, Cell Biology, etc.) or Chemistry Required Experience and Skills**:
  • A minimum of 10 (for BS or BA), 5 (for MS) or 0 (for PhD) years of pharmaceutical industry experience
  • A minimum of 5 years of direct experience in quantitative QQQ Mass Spectrometry assay development and implementation.
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
  • Be able to work independently; strong leadership skills
  • Ability to execute within a matrixed organization
